text: Aon Center is a skyscraper in Chicago, United States. It is 346 meters (1,136 feet) tall and has 83 floors. It was built in 1973 and is one of the tallest buildings in the world and the third tallest in Chicago. At first it was named the Standard Oil Building, but when the name of the company changed in 1985 it became the Amoco Building. The building was sold and became the Aon Center in 1999. == Photo Gallery == Image:2004-07-14 1880x2820 chicago aon looking up.jpg Image:Aon Center (Chicago).jpg Image:Aon Center 051015.jpg Image:Aon Center (Chicago), north face.jpg Image:2Prud.jpg Image:Aon and Blue Cross Blue Shield.jpg ==Related pages== * List of tallest buildings in Chicago * List of tallest buildings in the world == Other websites == * Emporis.com - Aon Center * SkycraperPage.com â€“ Aon Center Category:Skyscrapers in Chicago Category:1973 establishments in Illinois
